text: Draft - Whisky barrel notes with a bit o booze. Jet black with a rich decent brown head. Lots of woody barrel notes and whisky and not enough roast.
Wstrząsająco smaczne piwo, whisky, beczka i czekolada, ipowa goryczka zupełnie schowana za tymi atrakcjami - rzecz nieczysta gatunkowo ale tak zmysłowa, że każde podniebienie udobrucha

Közepes, nem túl tartós hab, fekete szín. Csokis, fűszeres illat. Íze kissé száraz, csokis, fűszeres, némi aszalt gyümölcsös aromával. Testes, enyhe szénsavtartalmú, közepesen keserű. Kellemes, jó összhangú, jó egyensúlyú sör.

Bottle. (10.1% - pretty sure there was only one release of this). Anyway, pours jet black with a tan head. A surprising amount of hoppiness to the aroma considering its quite old now (over a year out of date); resiny pine along with smokey chocolate. Lots more of those in the taste, along with vanilla and some sour cherry and oak towards the end. Finishes with a full on coffee bitterness.
Big roasty beer, more on the hoppy Impy stout side than Black IPA. Rich, decadent, enveloping. Top job.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
backlog. draft. Had some age on it when on draft. Pitch black with a silky mouthfeel. Excellent vanilla scotch notes, some earth but quite velvety. Nice

Rating #2202 - 2015.12.01 - #CraftBeerFantasyLeague Battle : Barrel-aged Beauties. This finished 7th of 9 entries. #JeriRyan Pours a jet black. Aroma is a violent clash between toasted malt, and grassy floral hops, and a yeasty spiciness. Taste is mildly hoppy, resinous grassy floral and noble hop notes tempered with a pleasant coffee, chocolate, burnt sugar sweetness of the toasted malt which is the dominant player - roast forwar. Scotch whisky barrel smooths out some of the alcohol but removes the sharpness of the bitterness, aging process has the floral hop nose diminished.
A really smoky and very hoppy black ipa with a lot of roasty qualities. Its pretty well made but not my sort of thing.
How: bottle Appearance: black with a minimal brown head. Aroma: strong cherry scent, spice, ripe fruit, smoke, milk chocholate, figs and raisins. Palate: full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, fruits, cherries
Appearance-brown, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

330 ml bottle found at the Uiltje Bar. Pours an oily black with a moderate retentive head. Aromas of muted pine and tropical fruit probably noting its age with a coriander like spice. Rich Flavors follow same with a nice spicy barrel addition - just enough to add character without overpowering. Classic and excellent stuff from these guys.
A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of alcohol and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, and alcohol, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle at BD57, june 20th 2015. Dark brown body with a small tanned head. Aroma of roast and alcohol, dark fruits. Taste is sweet, sugary with dark malts, plums, licorice. Solid bitterness, but lacking a bit fruity hops for a cda for me. Good robust malty finish.

BBE 03-12-15. Mustanruskea, kotikaljamainen olomuoto, kahvicremamainen pieni viipyvä tumma vaahto. Tumma, makea, huumaavahko tuoksu. Suutuntuma makea, lämmittävän alkoholinen, pehmeän samettinen, vahva mutta kuitenkin vähän yksinuottinen, vetinenkin jopa. Lämmettyään Bläkki-ipamaisuus tulee jo esille. Black IPAksi uskomaton suoritus, muutoin hyvä mutta ei huipputasoa.

Pitch black with a small fine tan head, good viscousity. Aromas of brown/candis sugar, milk chocolate, some whaff of tropical fruit, light woody and a certain complexity. Rayher lively, smooth, pronounced body. Light milk chocolate sweetness, solid tropical fruit hop bitterness with a woody astringency. Overall well balanced, lasting roast, hoppy dry finish.

Bottle thanks to Nikos! Pours black, large tan creamy head, slow to dissipate, great lacing. Aroma is roasty pine plus oak tannins. Flavor is light plus sweet, fully bitter, pine, roasted malts, lactose. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, lingering strong, harsh bitterness. Pine sap.

Aroma is licorice, molasses, caramel, toffee and fig. Taste is rich chewy malts with raisins ,caramel and light clove. For the abv it is quite smooth. Light tartiness on finish. Appearance is a dark clear amber with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur. BB 03/12/2015. black color, small dark coffee-colored. smells of spices, creamy, coffee, licorice, lactic, light coconut. full body, soft carbonation, slick moutfeel. tastes quite soft with notes of licorice, milk chocolate, light sweetness, light wood, whisky notes, spices, . finishes rather creamy with notes of spices and milk chocolate. tastes a bit oxidized, which might be an age issue, overall good stuff though. nice barrel notes, drinks quite nice.

Bevuta scaduta di 2 mesi. Aroma di scotch, cioccolato al latte. Nera impenetrabile, riflessi rossi, schiuma cappuccino fine e persistente. Attacco dolce, in bocca prosegue quanto in aroma, chiude molto amara. Luppolo poco presente in aroma, di più nel ricco sapore erbaceo, probabilmente a causa della bottiglia scaduta. Complessivamente prodotto di altissima qualità.

Imperial Black Milk India Pale Ale leżakowana w szkockich dębowych beczkach.

Poezja smaków i aromatów! Tykająca bomba w płynie.
Była czekolada, triple espresso, słody palone, trochę wędzonki, karmel, toffi, ciemne owoce, cytrusy i żywica od amerykańskich chmieli, mleczne akcenty i cała masa innych rzeczy.
Piwo przypominało trochę porządną whisky, jakiegoś dobrego -kilku lub -kilkunastoletniego Single Malt-a.
Alkohol świetnie ukryty.
Iście królewskie piwo.

12 oz from Triangle Wine for 3.99. Pours black with maybe a slight brownish hue and a tan head. Lots on the nose; some bourbon notes, fruit, vanilla, hops. Taste is slight lactose up front, licorice and the barrel-aging coming through. Boozy and slightly chalky on the end. Body is slightly creamy with a dry finish. Otherwise not unusual in any way for the style. Solid black IPA with enough going on to make it different.
On tap at CBC15. Black with beige head. Aroma and taste are big, coconut, chocolate, coffee, grains, malt, caramel, wood, licorice, cocoa, alcohol, vanilla and biscuits.

On tap at Whats Brewing 2015
Dark, black in glass, thin tanned head. Smell of dark malts, roast, citrus hops, alot of complex aromas. Heavy sweet, alot of citrus, dark malts, toast, roast, very siljy texture. Heavy bitter, zesty and resiny tail. A superb black ipa!

Bottle a black colored beer with a beige head aroma roasted malts spicy citrus dark fruits fruits some smoke and hops flavor roasted malts spicy citrus dark fruits licorice some oak and bitter hops in the aftertaste

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 3.12.2015 - czyli kilka dni po terminie. CIemne, czarne wlasciwie, z bardzo ladna, bezowa piana. aromaty dosc stoutowe, ciemne owoce, czekolada, rodzynki, zboze - aromaty od chmielu uciekly w zwiazku z wiekiem jak sadze nieco, choc sosnowa zywica tez jest . W ustach bardzo fajnie pelne, z ewidentnym ale szlachetnym, slodkawym alkoholem, dosc wysoka goryczka. pojawia sie tez kawa ktorej w aromacie nie bylo. bardzo fajnie to wszystko ulozone i zlozone. bardzo dobre.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

(butelka 03.12.2015) Barwa czarna, piana intensywna, zdobiąca szkło. 
Aromat słodki, żywiczne chmiele schodzą na drugi plan, a dominują ciemne słodowe nuty: dużo słodkiej kawy z mlekiem, wanilii i sosu sojowego. Słodki i złożony. 
W smaku słodkie. W pierwszej kolejności pojawia się słodka kawa - coś jak kopiko i mleczna czekolada, w tle suszone czerwone owoce i subtelny posmak drewna. Goryczka wysoka, żywiczna. Alkohol po ogrzaniu wyczuwalny, ale dostojny i ułożony. W ustach pozostaje posmak słodkiej kawy i lekko ściągającego drewna. Niezwykle bogate i intensywne piwo. Bardziej RIS niż Black IPA.

ASPETTO: nera, con schiuma color nocciola, fine, abbondante e persistente. AROMA: un mix tra erbaceo, caramello, liquoroso e caffè. Particolarmente intenso e gradevole. GUSTO: allattacco è sia dolce che amara. Intense note di caramello, tostato, liquoroso (soprattutto se si lascia riscaldare) ed erbaceo, combinate tra loro in modo da rendere la birra molto particolare e allo stesso tempo saporita. Veramente consigliata!

0,33l bottle @ Brewdog Helsinki. Pours very dark brown with a high creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and ashtray. Flavor is roasted malts, liquorice, chocolate, coffee, lactose and loads of hops. Incredible.

Bottle at csakajo. Dark brown, almost black colour with a small beige head. Nose is mostly dominated by the milk stout. Taste is medium bitterness, with some licorice. A very nice interaction of beers. The sip begins with the milk stout-y notes, and ends with notes of a black ipa with a smoked intermezzo. Very nice and very complex beer. Very interesting beer, probably one of the best beers Ive ever had.

On tap @ Whats Brewing 2015. Jet black body, small beige head. Coconut, chocolate, coffee, grains, wood, caramel and hints of licorice, cocoa, vanilla and biscuits. Taste is licorice, wood, coffee, caramel, grains and hints of alcohol, herbs and dark malts. Full body, medium carbonation. Nice complex imperial stout with great balance.

Wow. Sort Maelk is one of my favourite beers, so I had high hopes for this and it doesnt disappoint. Malty, creamy, roasty milk stout goodness with fruit pulp & bitter hop finish. Whisky and booze in the background. Best Black IPA Ive had.

330 mL bottle. Essentially black pour, small tan head. Rich stout aroma, dark chocolate, liquorice, some whiskey booziness. Fairly strong bitter hop taste, bit of woodiness. Very nice beer that mixes the best of a bunch of styles.

Appearance: nearly solid black with one fat finger of rocky mocha head, good retention and spotty lacing. (4/5) Aroma: dark chocolate, liquorice, floral, whiskey, roasty malt, coffee with cream. (9/10) Taste: moderately strong sweet, moderately strong bitter. (9/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, medium duration slightly warming finish. (4/5)

Oh yeah - that is some serious shit right there. Run, dont walk, yadda yadda yadda. To Øl Sort Mælk RIS blended with Brewdog Hardcore DIPA: you get the full creamy character of an RIS, combined with the floral hops of a DIPA - whats not to like? (And, this might be an example of weaknesses cancelling out - in particular, Ive found the Brewdog Hardcore to be a bit too malt forward for my preference, but in this collab/blend, that somewhat minor sin gets washed out by the heavy sweetness of the RIS anyway, so it doesnt really count for much.) Yes, its a bit of a kitchen sink of flavours, and its not something youre likely to session - at least, not for very long - but it is something youre gonna want to try. Given the fact that this is actually a blend, Im not completely sure this is really a true "Black IPA," but if it is, its probably one of my favourites of the style. (17/20)

Bottle at home, 1st October 15. Pours thinnish and black, not much head. Aroma is liquorice, rose water, whiskey, hops. Taste is hop forward, good bitterness, liquorice, lots of barrel, nice whiskey. Great beer that straddles styles

Bottle. Pours is dark with thick to medium persistent beige head. Sweet aroma of malts, fruity, figues, plums, milk chocolate, liquorice. Taste is sweet, light bitter, solid malty body, fruity notes. full body, creamy to oily texture, medium, coffee like, bitter finish.
From tap at CBC 2015. Black with a small beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, caramel, spice, hops, fruit, oak and bitterness.

Tap at Fairbar. Black body with a brown head. Very hoppy aroma with caramel and roasted malt. Very rich taste, both sweet and highly bitter, but well balanced. Medium body with average carbonation and a creamy texture. Bitter coffee finish. This beer is fantastic, equally tasty and drinkable. Try it.

Bottle. Thick black pour, small off-white head. Nice aroma of whiskey, passion fruit, licorice and roasted coffee. Taste of bitter passion fruit, peach, licorice, mild whiskey booze, creamy milk chocolate and caramelised malt. Soft mouthfeel. Lots of flavors, bit messy, but very nice.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma pine, roasted malts, wood, roasted malts, licorice, dark fruits. 
Taste dark fruit chocolate caramel sweets, some roasted piney bitter. 
Mouthfeel thick, creamy. 
Amazing beer.

Bottle, consumed during my 2015 FF draft. Very hearty dark borwn with a light brown head. Lovely f=dark malts (very rich) with equal influences of pine and woody barrel traits, but with very low bitterness. 10.5%?!? Nope, cant tell. Im not sure about the black IPA designation (strong ale would be more appropriate ofr sure), but I dont care-- this beer was great!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 33 cl. 482. BB 03/12/15. Noire comme la nuit. Cette bière montre aussi une mousse riche et crémeuse. Le nez est nettement sur des notes de pin et dorange. Belle fraîcheur de la forêt. À cela se rajoute des notes modérées à faibles de bois, de scotch et de malts noirs. Tout est nettement dominé par les houblons. Au goût, les houblons floraux, forestiers et fruités (agrumes) rencontrent du café, du bois brûlé, de leau-de-vie, de la vanille et du chocolat. En bouche, bon corps costaud avec un pétillement au ralenti et une texture crémeuse. En finale, une présence de la barrique qui nest pas prenante et qui laisse une place à une amertume fabriquée par les houblons et par les malts rôtis.
Awesome and very unique! Dark brown/black pour. Thin head. Flavour of sugars, lactose, roasted malts, hops, pine, resin, and some spices. Enjoyed it a lot!

Bottle camping in France. Black pour, thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, tobacco, licorice, coffee, quite spicy, some peat, vanilla and some knackebrod. Flavor is quite bitter, burnt, some tobacco smoke and spices. Unique flavors and well balanced, even though it is quite intense. Nice sipper.

Didnt really taste the full hoppiness in this one, but it was still pretty good. Pours thick black, with a tan head. Aroma of malts, dark fruits, and a but of hops. Strong malty taste, but satisfying finish. Id prefer the coffee IPA stout to this one.

33cl bottle at home from Only Good Beer, Budapest. Body is black, head is big, rocky, brownish, mostly lasting, good lacing. Nose is citric, sour fruity, light liqueurish, roasty. Flavor is tons of dark chocolate, coffee, dried fruits, light smoke, old wood, dusty old attic, toast, ash, toffee. Light sweet, heavy roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty, hoppy, cocoa heavy bitter, light alcohol warmth, later more hoppy which slowly takes over the roasty feel. Full body that you can almost chew, creamy and sticky texture, soft carbonation. Excellent dessert beer, quite easy to drink, awesome!

330ml bottle pours black in color with a finger of light brown head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is dark chocolate with roasted grains, whiskey and citrus. Taste is a roasted grain and citrus hop bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness and a bit of whiskey in the finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Alcohol is well hidden. Very smooth mouth feel. Overall, a well crafted DIPA with very stout like qualities, very tasty and enjoyable.

Bottle. Appearance is thick black motor oil with mocha head. Aroma is coffee roast, pine, smoke, and peat. Taste is pine, coffee, and oak, medium body, smooth coffee roast finish. Really well balanced, not much in the way of scotch character but I dont think thats a bad thing, its very roast forward with a nice amount of oak, its also super smooth, very delicious stuff.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2015, Green Session - fuzzy dark brown to black coloured pour with a beige/tan head. Aroma and taste is a mix of roasted malts and dark fruits, plum, raisin, cocoa, prominent pine and grassy hoppy, some caramel, roasted hoppy finish. Great stuff.
Duft ristegodt humlet dyb kraftig dugt lidt lakrids smag sød ristet chokolade dyb humle smag god dyb rastsødme kaffe

Bottle at Rotterdam. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with coffee, bourbon, oak, nuts, toffee, roasted malts and licorice. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, coffee, licorice and bourbon. Exquisite brew.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours black with a small brown head, lacing. Aroma of malt, dark chocolate, licorice, caramel, fresh fruity hops, coffee. Flavor is malt, licorice, coffee, fruity hops, citrus, alcohol. Full body, lively carbonation, warming alcoholic finish. 020515

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with medium, densed, light brown head. Medicore lacing and head retention. High aroma of dark fruits - raisins, pulms, nice medium vanilla and oak aroma. Also some medium caramel and sugary notes. Taste in the biggining is light sour, than its becoming more and more biiter, aftertaste is highly bitter. Medium to full body, creamy texture, medium carbonation, finish is dry, bitter and astringent. Little alcohol warming. Definetely worth trying.

330ml bottle. Jet black colour with average to huge, thick, firm, frothy, fully lasting, tremendously lacing, beige to tan head. Dark malty aroma shows hints of BA, some oak and vanille is interwoven, a touch of of toffee, treacle and leather, widely disguised hints of fruity hop. Taste is dry, thereby moderately sweet dark malty, toffee basis, fruity hoppy overtones with orange touch, all predominated by oak, leather and vanilla BA notes, some treacle shines through, even hints of chocolate and coffee flash up in the finish; rich and full bodied. An intersexual, transgender, Black IPAish drag queen Impy Stout, BAed.

29.05.2015, 0,33l bottle shared with Palme @ Schouskjelleren:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly concentrated, dark malts, hops, leafs, pine needles, dark sugar, caramel, weeds, sour coffee, grass. Taste is slightly sour-ish, oak, whisky, dark malts, dark sugar, harsh grass, weeds, pine needles, hops, bark, licorice, peat, leather. Longlasting bitterness, slightly harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Bottle at April Tasting in Belgrade. Dark brown-black, small off-brown head. Very sharp aroma, indistinct hops, sharp lactic, calc heat, scotch-barrel, cola, creamy. Very interesting, odd aim but it hits pretty well. Worth trying.

Bottle: taster:
Small beige brown head.
Black beer.
Aroma reveals more of Brewdogs Hardcore IPA but theres some subtle milk/cream notes and some sherry/oak tones and a marzipan/darker fruity tint.
Flavour are coming through in a creamy jacket: cream, roast, bark, chalk, bitter, light spice/alcohol, some oak, earth, dried leaves, malt roast, leave roast, lacto, light pepper, light sherry, nutty, herbal hay toast...
Aftertaste is light spice, oak, earth, bitter, light roast and some coffee with a light subtle dryness.
Low carbo, smooth creamy close to silky mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle at Beer Hunters. Opaque black color, small steady off-white head. Alcohol, dark malts, rubber, hops and licorice in the nose. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Front is alcoholic and bitter. Then burned malts and licorice. Sticky. Not really black ipa but some kind of American Strong bastard.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2015 .33l beer @Harry?s. 10.1% version. Aroma is dark fruits, coffee, chocolate, sherry, berries, soft vanilla. Rich aroma! Flavor is alcohol, oak, coffee, hops, dark bread, exotic fruits, dried fruits,  syrup and herbs. Bitter and smooth and full flavor. Complex. Swell beer!

Pours a deep brown with thin tan head. Smells of pepper, dates, oak and sherry. On the tongue its all roasty meaty with some warming alcohol and a bitterness that really intensifies at the back. Brown sugar and sea saltiness lingers... Complex and shit. Super fucking duper beer.

Bottle. Black body with brown head Aroma is dried fruits plums and some dried fruits. Taste is raisins with cocoa and coffee. Aftertaste is very balanced between fruity bitterness and some roasted malts sweetness. Very nice one.

330ml bottle @Bir &Fud Bottega. Pours deep brown/black with a big beige head. Aroma of hoppy cappuccino, chocolate, vanilla, lactose, alcol, grassy notes... so rough and chaotic. Flavour is medium sweet with a strong bitter end, chocolate, coffee, alcol. High body, high carbonation. Rough, not my cup of tea.

Black pour with a decent tan head, which dissipates quickly. Pine, dark malty goodness, some tropical fruit on the nose. Taste is citrus, pine, some nice bitterness in there.... vanilla, cocoa, which kind of goes a little chocolate milk-y, coffee and roasty bitterness to finish. What I thought was a good, solid beer turned into a ridiculously well balanced, complex beer - frickin love it.

Pours a thick, inky black with a tan head. Nose is fruity, juicy hops. Peach, orange, passionfruit. Some burnt toast, coffee. Flavor is rich, juicy hops on the attack. orange, lime, peach. Then theres a rich, milk chocolate flavor backed by the creminess that the lactose adds. Theres coffee, theres charcoal, and then the finish is slightly sweet, a decent hit of peat, and more burnt toast. Wonderful thick and viscous, heavy body, silky mouthfeel. Complex, wonderful, incredible.

Pours a dark brown/black with white head. Nose is very fresh hops/earth/pine, vanilla and coffee. Taste is super fresh pine, grapefruit , vanilla with a bitter, subtle oak finish. Medium mouthfeel. Dont really notice the booze. Outstanding beer!!

Tap @ CBC. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hop, pine and grapefruit. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hop, pine, little smoke, grapefruit, pine, whiskey, medium sweet and medium bitter.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pretty impressive stuff. Crazy how a beer like this molds together like it does. Its creamy and sleek, piney and citric, then the finish just oozes mildly smokey whisky with loads of vanilla and oakiness to it. It has sweetness but that smokey whisky finish really mellows it out and brings everything together. Outstanding beer

Bottle from European local swap, many thanks to BenH. Almost black color with medium white head. Dark malt, caramel, citrus hops in aroma. Taste, dark malt, chocolate, grapefruit, pines, resin. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Tasty.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Clear, very dark red. Halo of dense, tan head. Complex aroma, comprising charcoal, dark chocolate, and brûléed grapefruit. Taste is soft sweet. Roast malt bitter. Full body, but not to the tune of 10 odd percent. Finishes long, roast malt, and pithy bitter. Very nice. Not sure what its reckoned to be, but its a good effort at it. Lovely.

[5/2/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 4th session. Black with a brown head. Aroma of hops, roast, wood. Sweet flavor with chocolate, vanilla, wood, roast and bitter hops. Full-bodied.

Tap @ CBC2015. Pours almost pitch black with a small dark brown head. Aromas of dark fruits, hops, licorice, medium roastiness, chocolate, light menthol-like notes. Taste is licorice, savory notes, dark fruits, malty, hoppy, dry finish.

Tap at CBC15! Pours a slightly transparent black with a brown head. Aroma has hops, licorice, roasty malts, menthol. Taste is sweet up front. Malty, gets more hoppy. Fine balance. Average carbonation and a full body.
Aroma is dark malts, hops and a hint of scotch. The flavor is dark malts, pine needles/hops, fruit and a mix of bitter and acidity in the finish.
Tap @ CBC 2015, green session. Brown with a light tan head. Nose is sweet, light boozy and some dried fruits. Taste is again boozy, milky, some light hoppy notes and then some roast.
Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150502. Colour is black with slightly brownish head. Aromas and flavuors: Fruits, citrus, hops and roaste malts.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Green session. Hoppy and roasted malty aroma. Citrusy piney, coffee and chocolate, wood and alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours very dark / black with decent tan head. Aroma of raisins, bitter roast and oak. Taste is a lot smoother and easy-going than I expected with a soft bitterness and scotch oak finish. Its a delicious beer but I wouldve welcomed more Hardcore.

Tap at CBC 2015. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and booze. Taste is of roasted malts, chocolate, licorice, dark fruits and wood. Very sweet with a great hoppy finish. Im not really into the idea of mixing beers, but this combination works surprisingly well. The hops gives the Sort Mælk part of the equation a dangerously drinkable quality (more than usual). ;-)

Tap @ CBC 2015. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is rather hoppy with some intense roast as well. Dry wood, liquorice, dry wood and some cocoa beans as well. The taste has dark roasted molts, liquorice, bitter hops, wood and bitter chocolate.
sample at cbc. pours black creamy tan head. aroma is malty, roasty. taste is very balanced. noce roastiness to finish.
Tap @CBC15. Nearly black with small beige film. Roasted, light jammy aroma. Roasted, dark choc flavor, hoppy bitterness and dried fruit. Oily mouthfeel and lasting bitter finish.

On tap at Fermentoren during CBC. 

Black with a medium tan head. Quite sweet with roasted malt, chocolate, wood, light whisky and some dark fruit. Also with toffee and hints of hops. Fairly bitter finish.

Pours dark with off white head
Aromas of caramel, bread
Taste has sweet notes of caramel, burned caramel, dried fruits
On tap at Fermentoren. Black with a small off-white head. Aroma of chocolate and booze with a touch of pine. Sweet roasted flavour with dark chocolate and licorice and dried fruit. Very sweet...
Tap @ Fermentoren, CPH. Pours black with a small creamy head. Smoke, roast, hops, coffee and licorice. Smooth and really soft! Nice

Pours black with large brown head. Hoppy citrus, pine aroma nicely balanced against the roasted, coffee stout character.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home picked up from Bottledog KingsX. Pours a clear dark maghoany brown / black coloured pour with a steadfast cream mid tan head. Attractive beer. Aroma is creamy milky coffee, chocolate, burnt pine needles hop, creamy. Some warming alcohol on the nose. Flavour is composed of full on creamy smooth coffee, dark choc, little roast, jammy fruit, pine hop. Warming alcohol. Palate is full, oily, little sticky hop, highish carbonation. I like it. Black IPA or Hoppy Imperial stout. Good stuff.

33cl bottle at home. Very dark brown with a medium tan head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Great bitterness with some subtle sweet tones. Pine, grapefruit, roasted malts, chocolate, ripe fruits, alcohol and spices. A tasty barley wine-ish BIPA.

Bottle. Pours a black color with a longlasting tan head. Has a roasted malty woody chocolate hoppy aroma. Roasted malty woody whisky chocolate flavor with hoppy bitter hints. Has a roasted malty woody whisky hoppy bitter milk chocolate finish.

Bottle 0.33l at the 7th Belgrade Beer Tasting all together finally.Taste with Alberto, Matt and Vlada.07.04.2015.Thank you luttonm for bringing this bottle.Pour it dark color with small white head.Taste and aroma of milky smooth, black fruits, whiskey, some hops on the back, roasted finish.Quite good balanced.Good

Bottled 33cl. Pours deep brown with an average tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, citrus fruits, wood, vanilla, whiskey notes and pine. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. Taste is a good mix between bitter and sweet. The scotch is only present in the back. Aftertaste ends up dry and bitter. A very nice (Imp.) Black IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at the 7th Tasting in Belgrade-Serbia, Belgian booty from markoijelena. Hvala bre! Pours dark brown coffee bean, minimal off white lacing. Nose: nutty, scotch, lactose, cherries. Mouth: alcohol, brandy, confusing and not terrific.
Det här var en käftsmäll. Fruktig, viss chocklad, mycket sötma i aromen. Smaken kraftig med toner av alkoholen.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2015 Bottle at home in London - sourced from Ales by Males. Pours deep, oily black with a dense, creamy mocha cap. Lots going on in the nose, some up-front charred wood, burnt honey, baking cocoa, touches of vanilla, earth, raisin. Medium to big sweet flavor with strong roasted malt character, plenty of bitter ash, bittersweet chocolate, some ripe citrus fruits, orange, grapefruit rind, scorched earth, smoke, dried berries. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation and velvety texture. Warming finish, piney and resinous, lots more burnt malts, roast, burnt marshmallows, dried fruits, berries and raisins, more citrus rind, drying wood, oak, dried toffee, figs. Wonderful complexity to this beer. Its certainly a punchy beast but it still drinks very well. Outstanding.

Bottle from Mikkeller Beer Shop. Black with a lasting light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. 030415

March 28, 2015. On tap at Brewdog Stockholm. 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is licorice, light roast, oak, grass, peaches, whiskey and pine. Taste is sweet licorice and ripe fruits, bitter roasted notes, some oak and whiskey, slight alcohol notes in the finish. Medium bodied, average carbonation.
Poured deep reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma of smooth vanilla, sweet berries, lactose and cocoa. Medium to full body, flavour as the aroma, tannins, roast malt and dark chocolate.

Aroma of slightly roasted malt, grapefruit, tropical, oak, milk chocolate, coffee, hint of vanilla, hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a nice long bitter finish. Full and strong flavoured. Great BIPA.

330 ml bottle. Pours a black colour with a beige small head. Aroma of strong herbal hops, some vanilla and quite strong whiskey notes. Flavour of heavy piney bitterness, resin, roastiness, licorice, whiskey, oak, molasses, lactose and citrus. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. Very rich and complex. A gimmicky beer on paper but yeah, its great.

31.12.2014. Almost black beer with brown head. Both aroma and taste have a lot going on. Aroma of pine, liquorice, resinous hops, whisky and oaky vanilla sweetness. Taste has oak vanilla sweetness, burnt malts, piney hops, coffee and liquorice, and at the end oak notes again. Fairly complex and very interesting mix.
Black body, tan head. Hoppy aroma with floral notes. Slightly bitter taste, roasted malts, quite bitter towards the end. Slick mouthfeel, decent carbonation. Pretty good overall.

Black colour with great beige head. Milky, roasted aroma, some vanilla, chocolate, coffee and pine. Smooth taste with also some milk, chocolate, coffe, roasted mats, gentle sourness and and herbal finish.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, citrus fruits, wood, vanilla, whiskey notes and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Mdium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Black IPA.

Czarne z bezowa piana. W aromacie po pierwsze laktoza, potem wanilia z beczki, chmiel raczej ubogi. W smaku slodko, mleczno, waniliowo, potem do glosu dochodzi goryczka, tworzaca typowa dla black IPA chmielowo - palona kontre. Bardzo ciekawe piwo.

Bottle at NK Bar, Stockholm. Black beer with a nice beige head. Roasted oak and whisky aroma, hops, citrus, hay, licorice, cocoa notes, some vanilla. Roasted hop flavor, vanilla, oak, whisky, perfume, soot, licorice notes. Quite nice.

Complete black liquid with a solid big creamy beige head. Nice lacing. Coffee, fruity, pine, chocolate and grapefruit hoppy aroma. Pure pleasure to have my nose deep into this one. Full body. Tad sweet and a fine bitterness. Soft carbonation and a bit oily texture. Coffee, chocolate, some oak, pine, tropical and grapefruit hoppy flavor. Well masked alcohol. Complex and tasty stuff. Dangerously mild or soft mouth feeling that made it a very easy drinkable ale. Spot on for my likings as a BIPA lover.[Bottle from Bottle Shop - Druid Street in London, England]

Niech się Ale Browar z Pintą pomylą i wymieszają Crazy Mike z Imperatorem Bałtyckim wyleżakowanym w beczkach po whisky (copyrigth Hesoo).

Cudowne piwo.

Bottle shared at Uiltje. Pours near black with a small beige head. Aroma of malt, a little cheesiness, chocolate, toffee, light wood and some fruity hops. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at home, from Ales By Mail, 14/03/15.
Pitch black with a solid tan head that stays for the show - looker !
Nose is pine needle, light charr, bitter tropicana, subtle whisky wood tunes, rich toffee, chocolate souffle, earthy hop.
Taste comprises, earthy roast, mineral notes, pine, charr, dark toffee fudge, liquoruce, woody barrel, earthy, light dirt, cocoa rub, fresh spruce.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with pine, wood and dusty hop bitterness.
Solid BA CDA, lots of depth, ticks the style boxes, great balance with the BA, drinks a good shade under the ABV @ top draw !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle @ Uiltje bar. Pours a pitch black beer with a reddish hue around the edges of the glass. Aroma of dry citrus, grapefruit, caramel. Flavor is a bit boozy, loads of sweetness, malty, big citric base going on here. Great complexity in this beer. Aftertaste is long and bittersweet. Great stuff.

American hops (pine with citrus) at first, then come coffee and chocolate mixed with some liquor. Beautiful creamy head, dark brown, almost black liquid. Taste is bittersweet, very balanced. Coffee and cocoa mixing in there, leaving great aftertaste. Some milk chocolate blending in as well. Superb beer.

Bottle 330ml. @ [ First Official Randers Tasting ] by HenrikSoegaard, at HenrikSoegaard house, Randers, Denmark. [ As To Øl / BrewDog Hardcore Mælk ].Clear dark black brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light brown head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, moderate to heavy hoppy, grass, pine, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, roasted, grapefruit, grass, pine. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20150124]

250ml at Mikkeller in Reykjavik. Aroma is hoops with coffee. Light milky. Appearance is red-ish black with a brown-ish head. Taste us sweet and bitter with a light sourness. Very carbonated for that style. Dry. Great. Gorgeous.

Aroma: toasted malts, intense fruits, caramel, light resin. Appearance: black, small, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: roasted malts intensify, floral hops, light coffee? Overall: fantastic Black IPA, excellent aroma
Bottle at CBR2015, Shoreditch.

Draft at Kex courtesy of Tobias, thanks! Opaque black, brown head with good retention and lacing. Nice aroma of pine boughs dipped in cocoa dipped in espresso. Taste is perfumy, roasty mint. Delicious.

bottle shared with colleagues, poured a deep dark brown to black colour with a tanned head, roasted malts, sweet caramel, toffee, citrus, pines bitterness, orange, butterscotch, oak, whisky hints, spiced aftertaste, small peat hint but not overwelming. great stuff!
Interesting beer, good bitterness, still some smoothness and body from the milk stout. Fruity and luscious, some raisons. Pretty good.

Tap at Kex. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is chocolate and roast malt, lactose, prunes and figs with licorice notes, earthy hops. Flavor is dark malt, lightly sweet, earthy and herbal hops with figs and prunes, chocolate notes and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Bottle. Black colour with brown head. Roasted, coffee and chocolate aroma. Sweet, chocolate, vanilla, wood taste, some fruitness. Medium to full body.

Very dark bown color, big tan head but in couple minutes settle to thin layer. Aroma is roasty malt, lactose, hops citruses, chocolate, coffee and liquor. Taste is medium bitter great balanced by sweet lactose. Flavor is hops, citrus, roasty malt, vanilla, bourbon barrel. Finish is dry with alcohol note and hint of sourness in aftertaste. Full body, smooth texture, low carbonation. Beer is nicely balanced and complex.

Prezentacja: ciemno brunatne, nie przejrzyste, beżowa niska piana opada do kożucha i słabo zdobi szkło,
Aromat: delikatny palony, marcepan, owoce tropikalne, laktoza, alkohol, po zamieszaniu bucha warzywami
Smak: kawa, słonecznik, likier kawowy, 
Odczucie: średnio treściwe, gładkie, nisko nasycone, finisz orzechowo-słonecznikowy
Ogólnie: byłoby całkiem nieźle, gdyby nie te warzywa zabijające aromat

Cervesa molt aconseguida, fort aroma i gust a xocolata i cafè, però també té tocs afruitats i licorosos.
Cerveza muy conseguida, fuerte aroma y sabor a chocolate y café, pero también tiene toques frutados y licorosos.

Draft at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma has some licorice, alcohol, some chocolate and vanilla. Taste is subtle, roasted malts and some vanilla. Palate is thin, though tasteful. Overall a nice beer, the mix works quiet well.
deep dark mahogany colour, huge, dense beige head; aroma of coffee, whishy and woody notes, some vanilla, and grapefruity-piney notes; taste is the same - excellent black IPA

(330ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Feb 6 2015) Pours pitch black with a big dense pale tan head that lingers without lace. Aroma of dark molasses type malts and milk chocolate sweetness, loads of woody, roasted notes, and a punch of peaty, smoky and boozy scotch. Hops provide pretty big notes of dark fruit and citrus for a barrel aged beer with a little pine resin. Flavour had lots of milk chocolate and burnt sugar, tons of peat and whiskey notes, wood, some vanilla, and lots of candied orange from the middle on. Finish has lots of lingering chocolate sweetness balanced by ashy roast and hop bitterness. Light in body for its abv with soft carb and a little alcohol heat. Gotta like scotch to like this beer, for one. Its a bit hot and a lot going on, so maybe it wouldve been better as an idea developed from scratch vs. a blend. I really enjoyed it though.

33 cl bottle. BBE 03.12.2015.
Pours pitch black color with a large beige head. Nice chocolaty aroma up front, some bourbon-y vanilla notes, roasted malts, some alcohol comes through also, subtle fruity hops too. Lots of vanilla and bourbon on the flavor too, milky chocolate, not that much hops but some orange and lemon to freshen it up a bit, mild licorice with some warming alcohol on the aftertaste. Extremely creamy and velvety smooth palate at first, turning into chocolaty bitter and lingering bourbon-woody finish. Very rich and complex, the aroma alone is stunning. Didnt quite expect it to be this good.
4527
Ciemno brązowe beżowa piana, zostaje po niej mgiełka. Aromaty stoutowe, chmiel, laktoza, odrobina wanilii i alkoholu. W smaku po kolei, stout, goryczka, alkohol. Pięknie ułożone!

Poured into a teku with a finger of coffee colored foam that dissipates quite quickly. Pours black but looks more like an ale than a stout. 

The nose shows a lot of the scotch and wood with small hints of peat. The wood adds a slight brightness (most likely vanilla). 

The palate shows high carbonation. The first impression shows a slight sweetness and a very nice brightness from the vanilla. These flavors in combination with the milk sugar makes it taste like a vanilla chocolate shake. The carbonation and consistency are enough to remind one it is an ale though. The bitterness mostly comes from the hops but it is barely noticeable. The scotch is shown prominently in the background throughout the beer and gives it an extra dimension. The flavors all come together very well in this beer and theres not a note out of place.

330ml bottle from Brewdog online store. Black brown colour, light brown foam head and aroma of malt, toffee & caramel, fruity, vanilla, oak, woody. Taste is malty, slight roasted & dark fruity hop notes, with woody oak, boozy, some bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, warming bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of pine, light dill, citrus, pine, coffee, wood, scotch and light cream. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter and very light sour with notes of scotch, pine, citrus, coffee and citric acid. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very peculiar. The component beers are better on their own.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus. Opaque black color, average to medium sized brown head . Aroma is malts, some roast, liquor. Taste malts, liquor, bitter, lightly alcohol. Medium body and carbonation. Quite good.

Bottle @ benzai. Black colour, large light brown head. Smells roasty, whisky, oak, grassy, hops, lovely. Tastes roasty, sweet, chocolate, whisky, oak, hops, grassy, green. Great. Full body, nice carbo. Amazing black ipa.

Bottled. Pretty much rubyish black colour with a beigeish brown small head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, mild toasted notes as well as some peat and mild citrusy and resiny notes. Flavour is very similar actually, with the toasted and peated notes just barely giving a slight punch from them. Actually this one was surprisingly balanced, although as it warmed up some barrel flavours became rather evident.

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours very dark brown almost black with a creamy brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, resin, very hoppy. Taste is sweet with pine grapefruit bitterness. Body is full, texture is slick, carbonation average and finish is bitter and pleasing with liqourice and roasted malt.

23-JAN-2015, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Black with lasting, creamy, lacing, Brown head.
Very intense with loads of burned, tarred malt. Loads of hops, grape fruit, pine, exotic fruit. Bull body, medium carbonation. Sweet with long bitter finish. More like a very hoped Imperial Stout (which it is!) than a Black IPA. Very rough, tarry and messy but I quite like it:-)
Bottle from Cornelius. Pitch black, small tan head. Tar and resin nose, dark dried fruit and chocolate nose. Full, thick and creamy mouthfeel, bitter finish. Slightly odd, but pretty damn good.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Piwo pite z kranu w Kontynuacja Katowice. Piana drobnopęcherzykowa, szybko redukująca się do koronki. Piwo czarne, całkowicie nieprzejrzyste. W aromacie amerykańskie chmiele i paloność - cascadian dark ale. Aromaty cytrusowe zlewają się z kawą. Delikatna czekolada. W aromacie można wyczuć naprawdę dużo. Smak. Perfekcja. Na początek kawa, gorzka czekolada, przechodzi w goryczkę z amerykańskich chmieli. Można ją opisać jako żywiczną. Finisz jest bardzo złożony, czuć beczkę. Zdecydowana wanilia i palony, gorzkawy aftertaiste. Alkohol całkowicie przykryty. Objawia się poprzez potężne rozgrzewanie w przełyku i żołądka. Pod tym względem czuję jakbym pił whisky a nie piwo. Jedno z najbardziej wybitnych piw jakie piłem. Piję je już od 30 min i nie wypiłem połowy a piję 250ml. Jest świetne.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Black colored with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, tar and hops.
Roasted flavor of hops, tar and licorice.
Roasted and hoppy finish.
Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma lactose present. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull BIPA/Sweet stout hybrid.
Bottle @ First Official Randers Tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, rich hops, flowers, wood and has a nice dry roasty finish. Lovely.

Bottle @ First Official Randers Tasting. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy light tan head. Clear aroma of roast, hops, liquorice and herbs, with some malty notes. Sweetish flavour of malt, yeast and liquorice, with notes of hops, cough drop and needles. Very complex. Lingering, bitter and sweetish aftertaste. Yummy stuff. My rating #3500.
33 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a thick brown head. Aroma is solid roasted and hoppy fruity. Dark roasted malty, breadish and crisp hoppy fruity. Lingering dark malty finish.

330ml bottle, pours cola black with a foamy tan head. Caramel treacle malt, light roast coffee, piney hop, oak, peat, grapefruit, lots of flavour balanced nicely. Full bodied with an oily sick texture, light bitterness to finish. Impressive

Bottle at home - shared by Mette, Thanks. Black - offwhite head. Burned, minerals, ok bitterness, dry bitterness, ok creamty body, whiskey, caramel, toffee, hard burned notes, burned vanilla ice cream, whiskey, light boozy, ashtray, gunpowder, licorice, a bit wierd - all over - but not unpleasant.

330ml bottle from BrewDog Glasgow. Almost black, good big beige foamy head. Citrus fruit & hop aroma. Smoky malt flavour. Strong milky tarry aftertaste with a hint of whiskey. Not really my thing but drinkable.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, hki. Black. Pretty intense green grapefruity citrus herby hops, combined with a good deal of burnt rubber roasty, slight salty malts. Med,full bodied, slight oily, but with a ton of bitters to clear it off. Black, salty licorice, but real hoppy too, and intensive. Coffee, some choco. Pencils. I have to give a good score due to the intensity. The flavours are a bit haphazardly thrown together tho.-- bb

Bottle BB Dec 2015. Black, no real head. Aroma is quite light, pine, softly smokey, jasmine  maybe spaghetti bolognese  or maybe Im losing it. Body is medium, soft carbonation, quite rich and smooth. Taste has plenty of alcohol, pine, liquorice, soft smoke, woody finish. As it warms up you get more from the aroma and the flavour becomes more salty and boozy. Decent (3.75).

5th January 2015Opaque brown beer, small pale tan head. Smooth and slightly viscous palate. Decent fine carbonation. Creamy dark malts with a touch of dark chocolate and a whisper of roasty bitterness and coffee. Spicy pine hops with a trace of tropical fruits. Smooth finish. Mild spicy bitter linger. Nicely integrated and pretty drinkable for its abv.

Bottle at home from ales by mailOpaque dark brown black with pillowy amber tan head. Fruity redcurrant, smoky whisky and fruity milk stout notes, cola, chocolate orange. Full bodied, lively carbonation, rich chocolate, piney, orange peel, smoky,cocoa, complex.

330 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Black body, with a big, dense, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of chocolate, lactose, coffee, wood, dark fruits, citric hops, grass.
Tastes of chocolate, coffee, whisky, booze, wood, citrus, some pine and dark fruits.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a quite lively carbonation.
Finishes warm, alcoholic, roasty, with whisky and lemon zest.

Wow! One of the most unique Black IPAs Ive had so far, "imperial" in every way! Complex and heavy stuff, but with a great balance and quite good drinkability for this ABV. Really delicious!

33 cl bottle @ BrewDog Helsinki. Batch #182, BBE 03.12.2015. Aroma is a bit light with sweetish whisky tones and some licorice. Flavour has smoke, strong whisky notes with peat, woody tones, tobacco and ash. Also milk chocolate and grapefruit-like hops in the background. Finishes with lingering whisky tones /& peat. The whiskey is too strong here, perhaps this could use some months for settling. Reminds me of Bitch Please.

330ml bottle @ Brewdog Helsinki 
BBE 03/12/15 - Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of fruits, roasty malts, lactic notes, licorice, coffee, oak, wood and hints of berries. Taste is smooth, hoppy and roasty with notes of coffee with milk, licorice, hints of oak, vanilla, wood and ash. Finish is roasty, bitter and sweetish with some milky coffee notes, licorice, oak, whisky and fruity hops. Quite untypical, but works surprisingly well. Each sip tastes like a different beer. Complex and layered stuff.

Hoppy nose (citrus, pineapple, grass) with some underlying dark roasted malts. Extremely smooth over the tongue this beer is a mish mash of flavours (as I guess you'd expect), however it works rather well with the light fruity start giving way to a long bitter finish of coffee & hops. An exceptional beer made all the better by its experimental nature.

Rated by BrewTom
Bottle at home... Deep black... Thin tan lacing... Soft dry chocolate.. Soft pine nose... Bitter herbal roast... Soft bitter roast... Soft malts...burnt toffee ...  Something not working for me...
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, grapefruit, liquorice, pine, coffee, and chocolate - with a bitter finish.

Bottle from BrewDog Online. It pours jet black with a decent tan head. The nose is rich roast, smooth, creamy, lots of berry, jammy, oak, milk chocolate and liquorice. The taste is bitter, rich roast, charred wood, creamy, dark chocolate, grapefruit, lemon rind, liquorice, smooth whisky, light tar, pepper, dark fruits, earth and warming alcohol, with a lingering bitter finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation. Brilliant. Flavoursome and punchy, yet smooth and very drinkable. A joy to consume.
Bottle at home. Pours jet black with a thick frothy head. Smells licorice, sweetness, malt, hops.. tastes.. amazing. Dark, malty sweet and hoppy bitter all at the same time. A most amazing collab.

Pours jet black with a 3 finger brown thick head, which calms to a lining after a few minutes. Aroma is liquorice, resinous hops and some prunes. Taste takes on characteristics of both an IPA and a stout, very fruity (lychee, mango) initially then some coffee and dark chocolate notes kick in. Raisin tastes also evident on the follow up. Very silky mouthfeel and a medium-to-full body. Wonderful combination of styles!

Bottle at Beergeek courtesy of Benh. Cheers pal. I absolutely loved the Sort Maelk - One of my favourites ever. I have sunk more Hardcores than any other IIPA - Also a firm favourite. With the Hardcore Maelk, Im a wee bit conflicted. Its tasty but I have to say its worth less than the sum of its parts. Tastes great like it was brewed by a world class brewer but Id rather you served me two halves of the base beers than one whole of this.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma is big, very fruity, resinous, licorice. Taste of pine, mango, licorice, chocolate. Thick and creamy. Tidy

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 The whisky comes through on the nose, and the milk stout gives a luxurious mouthfeel. Just needs even more hops, or whisky to make it world class. 
Re rated , from an aged bottle, the whisky and the lactose have mellowed, to produce a brilliant beer.

Bottle from BD Online. Jet black, foamy tan head. Aroma of char, burnt toast, some vanilla, pungent hop. Medium viscosity, oil sweet and creamy on the palate. Rich sweetness, treacle, toffee. Long hop bitterness and a bit of a plasticky burn. Slightly acrid finish, which lets it all down.

Bottle from Brewsog Bar Stockholm. Pours matte black with a low mocha head. Aromas of citrus, peach, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, laxtose sugar. Taste is citrus, chocolate, peach, roasted malts, laxtose sugar. Mouthfeel is smooth with low carbonation.
Black ipa imperiale con un gusto favolosa che impatta con note di ciaoccolato e luppolo agrumato, leggero caffe e un finale torbato che avvolge e manda il palato in estasi. Divina!

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of coffee, milk chocolate, light vanilla, grapefruit, slight detergent and soap. Taste is initial sweet followed by a rich and intense slightly medicinal bitter finish. Medium rich, smooth body with soft carbonation.
330ml bottle from BrewDog online. Deep black colour with a tan head. Aroma has chocolate, coffee, and citrus. The taste has this in spades, with a deep toastiness.
Bottle brew dog Sheff. Black thin head. Lots of blackcurrant pine malts great hops taste same lots of bitterness pine great oily mouthfeel. Amazing stuff. Great.

330ml bottle from Brewdog online shop. Pours black, thin tan head. Aromas of pine, oak, booze, resin, faint dark chocolate. Taste is rich, oily, boozy, bitter finish. Bit of a clash of things going on, but somehow comes together, really nice. Stocking up on this bad boy.

33cl bottle from BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a dark brown color with a large brown head. Aroma is intensely roasty and hoppy with notes of pine cones and ashy wood. As it warms up more notes of vanilla whisky lactose an chocolate come through. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet, well balanced. Notes of dark chocolate, lactose, persimmon, pine cones, vanilla, port wood, whisky, espresso and ashes. Finishes lightly boozy with some citrusy hoppy note. Medium to full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, really good and well integrated, the whisky is not overdone.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is pine, grapefruit, roasty, smoky, taste is similar, quite dry and chewy, tar, wood.

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Black with a tan head. Aroma is fruity with tropical citrus and passion fruit, also has deep roasted malts and hints of liquorice. Taste is very different, fruity and sweet with also wood resiny bitterness, along with smooth roasty malt bitterness. Palate is lovely tingly carbonation and thick oily body. Lovely stuff.

Bottle from BD ShepBush. Pours black (no light comes through when held up) with a cream/tan head that fades to a thick ring and large patch. Nose of dank resinous hops, slight smoke, roast, espresso coffee, licorice. Tastes moderate sweet dark caramel, licorice, dark chocolate, decently bitter, resin, light citrus, some smoke, touch of whisky and oak, and some lacto acidity. Medium full body, creamy with some oiliness, soft carbonation, bitter roast, hop, and light lacto acid finish. Wow, complex and delicious, this is cracking.
